items.title: Conditional CSS, and a guide to using modern image formats.
items.content:
Frontend Focus

#‚Äã511 ‚Äî October 6, 2021 | Read on the web

Using Modern Image Formats: AVIF and WebP ‚Äî Highlights how modern image formats (such as AVIF or WebP) can improve compression by up to 50% and deliver better quality per-byte while still looking visually appealing. Compares what‚Äôs possible at high-quality, low-quality and file-size¬†targets.

Addy Osmani

Proposal for CSS @when ‚Äî The CSS Working Group recently resolved to adopt a proposal for adding when/else rules ‚Äî this sorta stuff will make handling complex media queries much easier to cope¬†with.

Chris Coyier

Consent Management Without Endless Configurations ‚Äî Transcend Consent ensures nothing is tracked without user consent, without sacrificing site performance or UX. The only solution that is fully compliant across all 200+ tracking technologies ‚Äì all in a lightweight, 30KB¬†bundle.

Transcend sponsor

A Guide to CSS Debugging ‚Äî Debugging in CSS means figuring out what might be the problem when you have unexpected layout results. This post looks at a few categories that bugs often fit into, how to evaluate the situation when you find some, and explore techniques that help prevent such¬†bugs.

Stephanie Eckles

‚ö°Ô∏è Quick bits:

  • Yep, Facebook (along with Instagram and WhatsApp) suffered a major outage earlier this week ‚Äî¬†this post from Cloudflare attempts to dig into what happened.
  • This article from Matthias Ott is a few years old now, but following Facebook's outage this week, it's still an apt reminder to have a corner of the internet to call your own (preaching to the converted here no doubt).
  • Starting with version 93, Firefox will monitor available system memory and, should it ever become critically low, will respond by unloading memory-heavy but not actively used tabs.
  • Following changes in Windows 11 both Brave and Firefox will intercept links that force-open in Microsoft Edge.
  • Here's a quick comic from Julia Evans explaining cross-origin resource requests (aka CORS).
  • Google has dropped support for IE11 in its core search experience ‚Äì users will now get a 'fallback experience' instead.

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Conditional Border Radius in CSS ‚Äî This is a neat little trick looking at how to use CSS comparison functions to create a conditional border¬†radius.

Ahmad Shadeed

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

iOS Browser Choice ‚Äî There‚Äôs been a lot of noise around iOS lack of real browser choice and Chris of CSS Tricks weighs in with his views and shares the thoughts of some¬†others.

Chris Coyier

How I Make CSS Art ‚Äî Goes from initial inspiration, to sketching and layering, through to coding the HTML, sorting positioning, responsiveness, and the final¬†CSS.

Yosra Emad

Front-End Dev Shortcuts in iOS 15 ‚Äî Exploring pre-made shortcuts in the iOS Shortcuts app that can be very useful for web¬†development.

Geoff Graham

Nick Scialli

How I Learnt To Stop Worrying & Love Animating The Box Model

Sam Thorogood

Roman Kamushken

items.title: Here's how to use the new CSS accent-color property
items.content:
Frontend Focus

#‚Äã510 ‚Äî September 29, 2021 | Read on the web

Simplifying Form Styles with accent-color ‚Äî The new CSS accent-color property makes it quick and easy to roll out brand colors to certain form inputs by leveraging user agent styles. This article looks at what it does and how to use it alongside color-scheme for simple, accessible checkboxes and radio buttons ‚Äî and imagine how we might use it in the¬†future.

Michelle Barker

ct.css ‚Äì Let‚Äôs Take A Look Inside Your <head> ‚Äî This is a new nifty little diagnostic snippet that helps spot common <head> performance bottlenecks¬†easily.

Harry Roberts

Shortcut Puts The 'Can' in Kanban and the Agile in Agile ‚Äî Imagine how much more you could get done if your project management tools didn't make you sigh. Shortcut is the ideal solution for task management, bug tracking, iteration planning, and reporting. Delight the scrum gods and give us a¬†try.

Shortcut sponsor

Bringing Instant Page-Loads to the Browser Through 'Speculative¬†Prerendering' ‚Äî Learn more about how speculative prefetching and prerendering in the browser are used, drawbacks of the current implementations, and how to participate in the Chrome origin¬†trial.

Leena Sohoni and Addy Osmani

‚ñ∂¬†¬†What's Coming in WCAG 2.2? ‚Äî This hour-long webinar dives into what you need to know about the upcoming version of the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines, plus how the changes benefit people accessing the web, and when you should adopt the new¬†criteria.

Matthew Putland

‚ö°Ô∏è Quick bits:

  • Legacy Chrome Extensions are to stop working from January 2023: "From January 2023, add-ons built with Manifest V2 API will fail."
  • The First Public Working Draft of the Synchronization Accessibility User Requirements has been published. It outlines accessibility-related user needs and associated requirements for the synchronization of multimedia.
  • You may not need to add a 'minimap' to your website, but I do find it quite a clean and pleasing thing.
  • This 'kinetic typography' page transition concept is neat, would work well for portfolio sites, galleries, etc. Reminds us of some of the bolder Flash designs of¬†yesteryear.

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Accessible Palettes: Stop Using HSL for Color Systems ‚Äî Following a recent color system project Eugene shares the most important lessons learnt about color and presents a new design and accessibility tool (Accessible Palette) born out of this¬†work.

Eugene Fedorenko

One Last Time: Custom Styling Radio Buttons and Checkboxes ‚Äî Restyling native HTML radio buttons and checkboxes without the use of visually hidden¬†inputs.

Scott O'Hara

A Content Model Is Not a Design System ‚Äî Having a great site isn‚Äôt enough, as folks are getting answers from apps, voice assistants, and rich search snippets ‚Äî this article looks at developing an omnichannel content¬†strategy.

Dougal MacPherson (A List Apart)

We'll Build Your Frontend Team In Days, Not Months ‚Äî Tell us your ideas for a frontend strategy, and we‚Äôll tell you what‚Äôs possible and what can be improved. 1h, no¬†charge.

The Software House sponsor

‚ñ∂¬†¬†You Make My Head Spin: Reducing Motion on the Web ‚Äî Some people suffer a lot when they encounter something like parallax scrolling ‚Äî¬†it can cause them nausea, dizziness, or other symptoms. These users can turn the ‚Äúreduce motion‚Äù setting on ‚Äî here‚Äôs a look at how to respect that¬†setting.

Eeva-Jonna Panula

Understanding min-content, max-content, and fit-content in CSS ‚Äî What these keyword values are, their differences, and how they can apply to a real-world¬†project.

Ibadehin Mojeed

The Five Most Common Website Accessibility Issues (And How To Fix Them)

'Firefox for Android is a Mess, and Something Needs to Change'
nonbirithm

What is ARIA? Common Misconceptions About Accessible Rich Internet¬†Applications
Bureau of Internet Accessibility

Jobs

Senior Frontend Engineer at UnifiHealth (Remote) ‚Äî We're a seed-stage health insurance startup. Are you looking to have a big impact? Apply to be our first frontend¬†engineer.
UnifiHealth

Find Frontend Engineering Jobs with Hired ‚Äî Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free for¬†job-seekers.
Hired

üîß Code, Tools and Resources

Can I Include(?) ‚Äî This browser tool helps determine if one HTML tag can be included within another HTML¬†tag, as per the HTML¬†specification.

Alexander Vishnyakov

Motion One: The Web Animations API for Everyone ‚Äî A new library for animations on the web. Built on the Web Animations API for a tiny bundle size and great performance. MIT licensed and with a nice simple API¬†too.

Matt Perry

Build Internal Tools in Minutes with Retool, Where Visual Programming Meets the Power of Real Code

Retool sponsor

MUI Treasury: A Collection of Ready-to-Use Components Based on Material-UI ‚Äî All components are customizable and you can try them out here where you can test them on various mock device¬†sizes.

siriwat kunaporn

Theatre.js: A JavaScript Motion Design Library for the Web ‚Äî Can be used both programmatically and visually to animate 3D objects created with things like Three.js, HTML/SVG, and even just small page elements or JS variable values. Docs and GitHub¬†repo.

Theatre.js

Huey: A Multi-Featured, Custom Color Palette Generator ‚Äî One of the nicer of such tools you‚Äôll find. Randomize the palettes or choose a starting color. You can select number of families/tints, then export as PostCSS, SCSS, or¬†Tailwind.

Zak Erving

items.title: Here's what Container Query Units can do
items.content:
Frontend Focus

#‚Äã509 ‚Äî September 22, 2021 | Read on the web

CSS Container Query Units ‚Äî I‚Äôll start by saying that CSS container queries are currently only supported via an experimental flag in Chrome, Edge, and Opera. However it‚Äôs always worth staying ahead with these sorts of things ‚Äî Ahmad digs into the¬†benefits.

Ahmad Shadeed

30 Seconds of CSS: Useful CSS Snippets You Can Understand¬†Quickly ‚Äî We linked to the first version of this a few years ago but it‚Äôs been updated and more than doubled in size since then. It‚Äôs a handy collection of CSS snippets for various situations like hover menus or¬†dynamic¬†shadows.

30 seconds of code

Auth Without Complexity ‚Äî They‚Äôve re-engineered authentication and access control from the ground up to remove all the complexity. Check out examples for React, Vue, Node.js and¬†more.

Userfront sponsor

Optimizing Images on the Web ‚Äî Cloudflare has a new testing tool for highlighting possible improvements you can make in delivering images to visitors. This post highlights what those improvements are (think format, size, quality, etc).

Greg Brimble (Cloudflare)

‚ö°Ô∏è Quick bits:

  • üìÖ Registration for the PWA Summit (taking place in two weeks) is now open. It's a free online event organized by Google, Microsoft, Samsung, and Intel.
  • Here's what's new in DevTools for Chrome 95, including new CSS length authoring tools.
  • You can now test sites using a three-digit User-Agent string (such as Version 100) via a Chromium flag.
  • Did you know the EyeDropper API is now in Chrome (95+)?
  • Stephanie Stimac of the Microsoft Edge team is hosting a free session looking at the future of HTML controls. It takes place tomorrow.
  • Here's another event taking place tomorrow ‚Äî Inclusive Design 24. It's a 24-hour free online event highlighting inclusive design and sharing ideas on and around that topic. Here's the schedule.
  • Should the <img> tag have a download attribute, just like <a> can?

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

The Future of CSS: Cascade Layers (CSS¬†@layer) ‚Äî ‚ÄúWhen authoring CSS we have to carefully think about how we write and structure our code. Cascade Layers aim to ease this¬†task.‚Äù

Bramus Van Damme

How to Record Audio Using the MediaStream API ‚Äî A practical introduction to using the Media Capture and Streams API to record audio from an end user‚Äôs microphone then do something with¬†it.

Shahed Nasser

‚ñ∂¬†¬†Default Focus Outlines: Don‚Äôt Remove Them ‚Äî Accessibility experts discuss the importance of the default focus¬†style

A11y Rules podcast

Chrome Is The New Safari. And So Are Edge and Firefox ‚Äî Thoughts on the long standing WebKit-only browser landscape on¬†iOS.

Niels Leenheer opinion

Building a Split-Button Component ‚Äî A foundational overview of how to build an accessible split-button¬†component.

Adam Argyle

Troubleshoot Frontend Performance Incidents Faster with Datadog ‚Äî Monitor page load times with First Contentful Paint, DOM Content Loaded, Time to Interactive, and other frontend¬†metrics.

Datadog sponsor

Exploring the CSS Paint API: Polygon Border ‚Äî Here's the latest entry in a series exploring the CSS Paint API, this time looking at how to go about adding a border to a clip-path.

Temani Afif

Make Microsoft Edge DevTools 'Your Own' ‚Äî A nice look at the ways you can make Edge‚Äôs DevTools suit your own¬†preferenes.

Microsoft Edge Team

Small Bundles, Fast Pages: What To Do With Too Much¬†JavaScript ‚Äî Bundle size matters and this post touches on a few ways to monitor and improve¬†it.

Ben Schwarz (Calibre)

Web Quality Assurance: From User Requirements to Web Risk¬†Management ‚Äî Elie Slo√Øm has spent the last 20 years thinking about web quality assurance, asking ‚ÄúWhat does quality mean for a web user?‚Äù. This article explains everything he has learned along the¬†way.

üëã Hey folks. Chris here, back at the helm after a week away. My thanks to Peter for taking the reins last week. Let's jump into this week's Frontend updates.
__
Chris Brandrick, your editor

Frontend Focus

#‚Äã508 ‚Äî September 15, 2021 | Read on the web

Designing Beautiful Shadows in CSS ‚Äî Another excellent tutorial from Josh, this time taking a considered look at how to use CSS to create ‚Äúrich, lush, lifelike shadows‚Äù and do away with the commonly found ‚Äúfuzzy grey¬†boxes‚Äù.

Josh W Comeau

Reducing the Need for Pseudo-Elements ‚Äî For years, pseudo-elements have helped frontend devs implement creative designs. They still have an important place, but Marcel explains here how we can now leave them behind in some scenarios, thanks to newer CSS¬†properties. This is a lot more interesting than it¬†sounds!

Marcel Moreau

How to Make the Web Accessible ‚Äî Join Jon Kuperman for this video course on website accessibility, covering screen readers, ARIA, focus management, tooling, and¬†more.

Frontend Masters sponsor

Less Absolute Positioning with Modern CSS ‚Äî A solid, practical explainer on how to go about reducing position:absolute usage by leveraging modern¬†CSS.

Ahmad Shadeed

What‚Äôs New With DevTools: Cross-Browser Edition ‚Äî Learn what‚Äôs new with the developer tools not just in Chrome, but in Firefox, Safari, and Edge too. One of those areas where just a little time spent becoming aware of the possibilities could shave off hours when it comes to¬†debugging(!)

Patrick Brosset

‚ö°Ô∏è Quick bits:

  • Version 8.4 of Google's automated website auditing tool Lighthouse is available now in Chrome Canary. This post highlights what's new.
  • The W3C's design system is now live.
  • Replay is a new visual debugging tool from some former Firefox Dev Tools team members.
  • The Web Fonts working group has published a Public Working Draft of 'Incremental Font Transfer'. The spec outlines methods to incrementally transfer fonts, allowing clients to load only the portions of the font they actually need, thus speeding up font loads.
  • Mozilla has reverse engineered the way Microsoft sets Edge as default in Windows 10, enabling Firefox to quickly make itself the default.

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

A Deep-Dive into VideoNG ‚Äî If you‚Äôve ever wondered how video rendering works in Chromium this detailed article covers just that, along with its evolution over the last few¬†years.

Dale Curtis (Google)

overscroll-behavior ‚Äî What you need to know about this CSS property (it controls whether an element will use ‚Äòscroll chaining‚Äô or¬†not).

Mojtaba Seyedi

Developer Decisions For Building Flexible Components ‚Äî A walk through of the decision process of taking a seemingly simple design for a component (often presented as a static mock-up) and deciding how best to translate it into code ‚Äî keeping in mind the needs of both users and content¬†authors.

Michelle Barker

Implementing Batch Editing in an Angular Data Grid the Easy Way ‚Äî Use this tutorial to learn how to use Kendo UI for Angular to create a Data Grid that allows updates and saves in¬†bulk.

Progress Kendo UI for Angular sponsor

Orchestrating Complexity with Web Animations API ‚Äî There‚Äôs lots to learn in the Web Animations API, as such here‚Äôs a how-to looking at learning both timing and playback controls ‚Äî a good foundation/starting¬†point.

Kirill Myshkin

Grainy Gradients ‚Äî This tutorial looks at how generate colorful noise to add texture to a gradient using only a small amount of CSS and SVG. There's code demo's here and what you need to know in regards to browser support. It's a neat¬†effect.

Jimmy Chion

Modernising CSS Infrastructure in DevTools ‚Äî A look at the history of CSS in DevTools, and the future plans for migrating to CSS Module¬†Scripts.

Kriti Sapra (Google)

Bundling Non-JavaScript Resources ‚Äî Learn how to import and bundle various types of assets from JavaScript in a way that works both with browsers and¬†bundlers.

Ingvar Stepanyan (Google)

Build Internal Tools in Minutes with Retool, Where Visual Programming Meets the Power of Real Code

Retool sponsor

Firefox‚Äôs bolder Default is a Problem for Variable Fonts
≈†ime Vidas

‚ñ∂¬†¬†Three Fun Uses for ::before and ::after
Kevin Powell

The Story Behind TryShape, A Showcase for the CSS clip-path¬†Property
Tapas Adhikary

How to Optimize Button Microcopy: Seven Suggestions with Examples
Maria Panagiotidi

Jobs

Walmart is Hiring Software Engineers ‚Äî Code at scale, Fortune 1 scale. Learn more about Software Engineering opportunities at¬†Walmart.
Walmart Global Tech

Frontend Engineer (m/f/x) ‚Äî Grow & work in our cross functional squads in an amazing environment, providing a personal educational budget and 30d of¬†vacation.
HOMEDAY

Find Frontend Engineering Jobs with Hired ‚Äî Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free for¬†job-seekers.
Hired

üîß Code, Tools and Resources

Tailwind Mobile: Mobile UI Components Built with Tailwind¬†CSS ‚Äî Includes lots of utilities and components with a native iOS or Material Design look, currently available for React, with plans for Svelte and Vue in the¬†future.

Vladimir Kharlampidi

Pollen: A Library of CSS Variables Inspired by Tailwind ‚Äî Features include no build process, no framework dependencies, and they can be used in external CSS, inline styles, and¬†CSS-in-JS.

Peppercorn

Starback.js: Create a Beautiful Falling Star Background ‚Äî This is a pretty specific feature to add to a website and won‚Äôt be useful for most projects, but the demo is pretty neat and the API allows you to customize the speed and look of the falling¬†stars.

Ahmad Saugi

flag-icons: A Collection of All Country Flags in SVG ‚Äî Plus the CSS for Easier Integration

Panayiotis Lipiridis
